IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: PROVIDES ITS STUDENTS WITH AN OPPORTUNITY FOR OUTSTANDING ACADEMIC, CAREER AND LIFE PREPARATION.
IRS990.MissionDesc: HARCUM COLLEGE PROVIDES ITS STUDENTS WITH AN OPPORTUNITY FOR OUTSTANDING ACADEMIC, CAREER, AND LIFE PREPARATION. WE TEACH, MENTOR, AND PREPARE STUDENTS FOR SUCCESS IN THEIR CHOSEN PROFESSIONS IN AN EXPERIENTIAL ENVIRONMENT. HARCUM'S CORE VALUES OF EXCELLENCE, CIVILITY, EMPOWERMENT, INTEGRITY, COMMUNITY SERVICE, AND RESPECT FOR DIVERSITY ASSURE THAT EVERY STUDENT IS VALUED AND SUPPORTED.
IRS990.Desc: HARCUM COLLEGE PROVIDES ITS STUDENTS WITH AN OPPORTUNITY FOR OUTSTANDING ACADEMIC, CAREER, AND LIFE PREPARATION. WE TEACH, MENTOR, AND PREPARE STUDENTS FOR SUCCESS IN THEIR CHOSEN PROFESSIONS IN AN EXPERIENTIAL ENVIRONMENT. HARCUM'S CORE VALUES OF EXCELLENCE, CIVILITY, EMPOWERMENT, INTEGRITY, COMMUNITY SERVICE, AND RESPECT FOR DIVERSITY ASSURE THAT EVERY STUDENT IS VALUED AND SUPPORTED. HARCUM COLLEGE IS A PRIVATE, COEDUCATIONAL, FULLY ACCREDITED, RESIDENTIAL AND COMMUTER COLLEGE IN BRYN MAWR, PA WHICH OFFERS 27 CAREER-READY ASSOCIATE'S DEGREE PROGRAMS. CAREER-INFORMED PROGRAMS ARE OFFERED ON CAMPUS, ONLINE AND OFF-CAMPUS AT PARTNERSHIP SITES THROUGHOUT PENNSYLVANIA. STUDENT ATHLETES COMPETE AT THE NJCAA IN VARIOUS SPORTS. THE COLLEGE CURRENTLY SERVES APPROXIMATELY 1,200 STUDENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE USED FOR A VARIETY OF PURPOSES AND CLASSIFIED ON THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AS DONOR AND BOARD RESTRICTED FOR SCHOLARSHIP AND PROGRAM SUPPORT. THE COLLEGE HAS ELECTED TO BASE ITS SPENDING POLICY FOR THE ENDOWMENTS ON A "TOTAL RETURN" APPROACH FOR WHICH THE STIPULATED PERCENTAGE OF 4% OF THE AVERAGE BALANCE OF THE PRECEEDING THREE YEARS WAS APPROVED BY THE BOARD. SPENDING OF $22,200 WAS USED DURING FY23.

TAX POSITIONS ARE RECOGNIZED OR REVERSED BY THE COLLEGE BASED ON A MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT THRESHOLD. THIS APPLIES TO POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN IN A TAX RETURN. THE COLLEGE DOES NOT BELIEVE ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS INCLUDE ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS.

CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT INTEREST AGREEMENTS -1,091. STUDENT AID NETTED AGAINST REVENUE ON FINANCIALS -7,633,440. INVESTMENT MGT. FEES NETTED AGAINST REVENUE ON FINANCIALS -64,272. REVENUE SHARE EXPENSE NETTED AGAINST REVENUE ON FINANCIALS -983,503.
RENTAL EXPENSES -1,500. BOOKSTORE COGS -81,953. CONSULTING FEE REFUND NETTED AGAINST EXPENSES ON FINANCIALS 437,651.
RENTAL EXPENSES 1,500. BOOKSTORE COGS 81,953. CONSULTING FEE REFUND NETTED AGAINST EXPENSES ON FINANCIALS -437,651.
STUDENT AID NETTED AGAINST REVENUE ON FINANCIALS 7,633,440. INVESTMENT MGT. FEES NETTED AGAINST REVENUE ON FINANCIALS 64,272. REVENUE SHARE EXPENSE NETTED AGAINST REVENUE ON FINANCIALS 983,503.
THE POLICY APPEARS IN THE COLLEGE'S CATALOG. IT IS ALSO CONSISTENTLY PUBLICIZED IN ALL OF THE COLLEGE'S HUMAN RESOURCES AND RECRUITMENT ACTIVITIES.

THE COLLEGE PARTICIPATES IN A NUMBER OF FEDERAL AID PROGRAMS ADMINISTERED THROUGH THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE FOLLOWING PROGRAMS: FEDERAL FAMILY EDUCATION LOAN PROGRAM, FEDERAL PELL GRANT PROGRAM, FEDERAL PERKINS LOAN PROGRAM AND FEDERAL WORK-STUDY PROGRAM. IN ADDITION TO THE FEDERAL PROGRAMS, THE COLLEGE ALSO PARTICIPATES IN THE PENNSYLVANIA STATE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION VOCATIONAL EDUCATION PROGRAM.

ALL FUNDS DISTRIBUTED TO STUDENTS ARE DONE SO IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE ORGANIZATION'S ESTABLISHED FINANCIAL AID POLICIES. THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS BASED ON VARYING AWARD CRITERIA INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, FINANCIAL NEED AND ESSAYS. SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS RANGE IN NATURE FROM SIBLING AND LEGACY SCHOLARSHIPS TO ATHLETIC AND PROGRAM SPECIFIC AWARDS. THE HARCUM GRANTS AND COMMUNITY BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE NEED BASED AND DETERMINED BY THE STUDENT'S EXPECTED FAMILY CONTRIBUTION. ATHLETIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO DISPLAY SUPERIOR ATHLETIC ABILITIES.
HOUSING WAS PROVIDED TO THE COLLEGE PRESIDENT AS A CONDITION OF HIS EMPLOYMENT AND AS A CONVENIENCE OF THE EMPLOYER. AS SUCH, THE HOUSING ALLOWANCE IS NOT INCLUDED IN HIS TAXABLE COMPENSATION.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: JULIA INGERSOLL, THE EXECUTIVE VP CAO & COLLEGE COUNSEL, IS MARRIED TO THE CEO OF INSTITUTE OF LEADERSHIP EDUCATION, ADVANCEMENT, & DEVELOPMENT (I-LEAD). THE COLLEGE SHARES 35% OF FEDERAL AID AND CASH PAYMENTS DERIVED FROM THE PARTNERSHIP SITE PROGRAM WITH I-LEAD. TRANSACTIONS WITH I-LEAD ARE AT ARM'S LENGTH.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipDescriptionTxt: SON OF THE COLLEGE'S PRESIDENT, AN ATHLETIC DIRECTOR
BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: JON JAY DETEMPLE II IS AN EMPLOYEE AS IS HIS FATHER, JON JAY DETEMPLE, THE COLLEGE'S PRESIDENT. JON JAY II'S SALARY AND BENEFITS ARE BEING REPORTED. JON JAY DETEMPLE II DOES NOT REPORT TO JON JAY DETEMPLE NOR DOES JON JAY DETEMPLE PARTICIPATE IN SALARY DISCUSSIONS RELATED TO JON JAY II.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE NUMBER ON PART I, COLUMN B REPRESENTS NUMBER OF DONORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE VICE PRESIDENT, CAO & COLLEGE COUNSEL AND THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE PROGRAM DIRECTOR HAVE A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS DISTRIBUTED EITHER IN PERSON OR ELECTRONICALLY TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS FOR REVIEW AND COMMENT AFTER THE FORM HAS BEEN REVIEWED BY THE FINANCE COMMITTEE AND MANAGEMENT AND PRIOR TO FILING. ALL COMMENTS ARE TAKEN INTO CONSIDERATION PRIOR TO FILING THE FORM 990.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE OFFICERS AND BOARD MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE ANNUALLY. FAMILY AND BUSINESS RELATIONSHIPS ARE SPECIFICALLY MENTIONED IN THE POLICY AS HAVING POTENTIAL FOR CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. THE DISCLOSURES ARE REVIEWED ANNUALLY BY THE BOARD. TRUSTEES AND DESIGNATED EMPLOYEES WHO ARE DEEMED TO BE IN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST SITUATION WITH RESPECT TO ANY MATTER BEFORE THE ADMINISTRATION OR THE BOARD SHALL REFRAIN FROM PARTICIPATING IN THE CONSIDERATION OF THE PROPOSED TRANSACTION, UNLESS SPECIFICALLY REQUESTED TO PROVIDE INFORMATION REGARDING THE TRANSACTION IN QUESTION. SUCH PERSON SHALL NOT VOTE ON OR TAKE ANY POSITION FOR OR AGAINST THE PROPOSED TRANSACTION. WHEN DEEMED APPROPRIATE, A NOTATION MAY BE MADE IN THE MINUTES OF THE MEETING THAT THE PERSON INVOLVED NEITHER PARTICIPATED IN THE CONSIDERATION OF THE PROPOSED TRANSACTION NOR VOTED ON THE MATTER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMPENSATION OF THE PRESIDENT IS DETERMINED BY AN INDEPENDENT COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD BASED ON COMPARABLE AND OTHER MARKETPLACE TRENDS AND PRACTICES. THE PRESIDENT'S EVALUATION AND COMPENSATION ARE DISCUSSED IN THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES' EXECUTIVE SESSION. ALTHOUGH A MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, THE PRESIDENT RECUSES HIMSELF FROM THE DISCUSSION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COLLEGE WILL PROVIDE ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, AND TAX RETURNS UPON IN PERSON, VERBAL OR WRITTEN REQUESTS.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT INTEREST AGREEMENTS -1,091.
